title: Ghost Moon
author: Butlin, Ron
snippet: deserted Minto Street to Queen's Crescent with Jean's hand in hers to grip hold of at each contraction, there came five hours of pain and then exhaustion, followed by more pain and more

title: Ghost Moon
author: Butlin, Ron
snippet: With Jean's help she found a discreet nursing home off Minto Street in the Southside, and booked herself in to stay overnight when her time came. She planned to give birth there, away from the snubs and sneers of a public ward, and without the shame of an empty chair by her hospital bed when the proud husbands came to visit with flowers.

title: Traced and Tracked; or, Memoirs of a City Detective, etc
author: Macgovan, James.
snippet: He had come upon him atthe roadside near the city trying to remove the ragged colouredhandkerchief with which he had bound up the ami, and whichhe was afraid might poison the wound. On getting this news I started for the South Side, andhad got as far as Minto Street, when, looking up one ofthe quiet streets leading towards St Leonards, I saw atramp seated on a gate step, and moved up to havea look at him. So minutely had the man been describedto me, that I recognised him at a glance.
